lab4

Class MortgageModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab4.MortgageModel

  • public class MortgageModel
extends java.lang.Object

    Mortgage Model

    This class holds the mortgage data, and performs calculations on this data
    Two key methods:
    1) calculateMortgageValues: This method takes the values entered by the user and sets the variables to the appropriate values using the mortgage formula
    2) returnScheduleInfo: This method returns a data object filled with either monthly or yearly payment information, depending on boolean parameter
    Since:
    2016-03-26

        public void calculateInterestFactor(double interestRate)

        Calculate Interest Factor

        This method takes the raw interestRate as a parameter and sets the appropriate interestFactor using the interestFactor formula
        Parameters:

      • calculateMortgageValues

        public void calculateMortgageValues(double payMonths,
                           double principleAmount,
                           double interestRate,
                           double comp,
                           double freq)

        Calculate Mortgage Values

        This method takes five double parameters and uses the mortgage payment formula to update the model data The method does not return any value, but once it has been called, the model will now hold the users latest mortgage payment information

      • returnScheduleInfo

        public java.lang.Object[][] returnScheduleInfo(boolean perYear)

        Generate Monthly and Yearly Payment Schedule

        This method takes a boolean parameter and returns either the yearly payment schedule, or the monthly payment schedule. It loops through each month and calculates the necessary values, each time updating the monthly data object. After each year, it also updates the yearly data object. Once the loop has finished, it then returns one of the objects, depending on the value of the boolean parameter.
